Tradeconfo.com FX Services - public API documentation

Version : 1.1.7

Created : 2016-Jun-19

Introduction

Tradeconfo.com FX API defines a set of REST based services that support FX brokerages and their agents and customers.

This document specifies the REST based access to a compliant Tradeconfo.com FX service. This includes ...

  • Customer accounts, beneficiaries and profiles
  • Trade and payment reports
  • Beneficiary creation
  • Quote requests and acceptance

The Tradeconfo.com FX API implements the JSON API format for all REST resources. The JSON API format provides a well defined layout for modeling resources and the REST services that support them.

Applications

The Tradeconfo.com FX APIs currently supports two applications ...

  • fx-customer-api
  • fx-domain-api

Notes

  • Supported applications
  • Obtaining an access token
  • Bootstrapping an fx-customer-api user
  • Bootstrapping an fx-domain-api user
  • Version management

API application : fx-customer-api

Resource REST endpoints
bank-accounts
GET bank-accounts/:id
Represents a bank account. Required for delivery of currency.
bank-account-field-sets
GET bank-account-field-sets?currency=:currency_id&country=:country_id
Defines a set of fields that are required to create a new bank account.
bank-transactions
GET journal/bank-transactions/:id
GET journal/bank-transactions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a completed bank transfer.
countries
GET countries
GET countries/:id
A resource representing a country.
currencies
GET currencies
GET currencies/:id
A resource representing a currency.
ledger-accounts
GET ledger-accounts
GET ledger-accounts/:id
Resource representing a single account in the general ledger.
ledger-entries
GET general-ledger/ledger-entries
Resource representing an entry in the general ledger.
ledger-balances
GET general-ledger/ledger-balances?query=customer-balance-sheet&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
Resource representing an aggregate of ledger-entries in the general ledger.
customer-accounts
GET customer-accounts
GET customer-accounts/:id
Represents a customer account
customer-subaccounts
GET customer-subaccounts/:id
GET customer-accounts/:id/subaccounts
Represents a customer subaccount
customer-bank-accounts
GET customer-bank-accounts/:id
GET customer-accounts/:id/beneficiaries
POST customer-bank-accounts
PATCH customer-bank-accounts/:id
DELETE customer-bank-accounts/:id
A resouce representing association of a bank account to a customer account . Required for delivery of currency.
customer-account-profiles
GET customer-account-profiles/:id
Profile for a single customer account
customer-quote-requests
POST customer-quote-requests
PATCH customer-quote-requests/:id
GET customer-quote-requests/:id
Represent a quote request. Contains one or more customer-quotes.
customer-quotes Represent a set of terms and conditions for a single currency quote.
fx-tickets
GET journal/fx-tickets/:id
Parent of a collection of fx-transactions
fx-transactions
GET journal/fx-transactions/:id
GET journal/fx-transactions?query=customer&customer=:id&start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a single transaction of one or more blocks
fx-transaction-blocks
GET journal/fx-transaction-blocks?query=customer-unsettled&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
GET journal/fx-transaction-blocks?query=customer-outstanding&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a single exchange of currency
fx-positions
GET journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-trade&customer=:id
GET journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-currency&customer=:id
Aggregate of a collection of fx-transaction-blocks 'grouped' by one or more relationship. The grouping is dependent on the query.
payment-instructions
GET journal/payment-instructions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
GET journal/payment-instructions?query=customer&customer=:id&start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a client instruction to make a currency delivery to a given bank account of a beneficiary.
payment-reasons
GET payment-reasons
Defines a reason for a payment. Intended to allow the API user to declare the reason for a transfer of funds in order to facilitate compliance checks. Used for UI presentation when creating customer-quotes and payment-instructions.
people
GET people/:id
GET people/self
Represents an individual
user-profiles
GET user-profiles/:id
GET user-profiles/self
Profile for a single resource owner

Resource : fx-customer-api / bank-accounts

Structure

Content of a 'bank-accounts' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-accounts
Attributes Type Required Comment
beneficiary string

The name of the account to be used for interbank instruction

beneficiary-address string

Address of account holder. Some destination payment systems require this for some account types

iban string

A valid IBAN

bic string

A valid swift institution identifier

account-number string

A valid account number for the destination country's payment system.

national-clearing-code string

A valid clearing code for the destination country's payment system. UK sort code, US ABA routing number etc.

object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage
Relationships Resource Required Comment
domain domains
currency currencies
country countries

Description

Represents a bank account. Required for delivery of currency.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/bank-accounts/:id

Returns a single resource.

Examples

  • 1 : Get resource
  • Hide

Example : Get resource

GET/fx-customer-api/bank-accounts/3 HTTP/1.1Accept: application/vnd.api+jsonAuthorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1N...
Response body...

{
    "data":{
        "id":"3",
        "type":"bank-accounts",
        "attributes":{
            "beneficiary":"Beneficiary 1",
            "iban":"GB31 NWBK 6000 0140 4647 33",
            "bic":"NWBKGB2LXXX"
        },
        "relationships":{
            "country":{
                "data":{
                    "id":"GB",
                    "type":"countries"
                }
            },
            "currency":{
                "data":{
                    "id":"EUR",
                    "type":"currencies"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

Resource : fx-customer-api / bank-account-field-sets

Structure

Content of a 'bank-account-field-sets' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-account-field-sets
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

The display name of the field set

description string

A brief description of the field set

fields object (many)

An array of field definitions. Each definition ...

  • MUST contain a string 'attribute' property that specifies the attribute name that must be included in the POSTED resource
  • MUST contain a string 'label' attribute containing a suggested display name
  • MUST contain a boolean required field that indicates if the attribute must be provided
  • MAY contain a string 'description' attribute containing suggested explanation of the field
  • MAY contain a string 'regex' attribute containing an input validation rule

Relationships Resource Required Comment
currency currencies
country countries

Description

Defines a set of fields that are required to create a new bank account.

A field set defines a set of attributes that need to be included on POSTed customer-bank-account resource together with suggest display information for presenting a completion form to a user.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/bank-account-field-sets?currency=:currency_id&country=:country_id

Returns a collection of field sests for a currency/country pair.

Query parameter Value
currency :currency_id A valid currency id
country :country_id A valid country id

Examples

Resource : fx-customer-api / bank-transactions

Structure

Content of a 'bank-transactions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-transactions
Attributes Type Required Comment
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
credit currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

local-deduction currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remote-deduction currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

type enum
charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
status enum

Transaction status

Valid enum values
PENDING Transaction not reconciled, funds in suspense
RECONCILED Transaction reconciled against customer account
references string (many)
narratives string (many)
advice-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
advice-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
credit-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

requested-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

received-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

local-charges-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remote-charges-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

beneficiary-name string
beneficiary-account string
beneficiary-address string (many)
beneficiary-bank-name string
beneficiary-bank-id string
beneficiary-bank-address string (many)
on-behalf-of-name string
on-behalf-of-address string (many)
payment-type string
payment-detail string (many)
Relationships Resource Required Comment
bank-account bank-accounts
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
ledger-account ledger-accounts
update-user people

Description

Represents a completed bank transfer.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/bank-transactions/:id

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/bank-transactions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd

Query parameter Value
start-date yyyy-mm-dd
end-date yyyy-mm-dd

Resource : fx-customer-api / countries

Structure

Content of a 'countries' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string countries
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

Two character country code - GB, US, etc

description string

User friendly name

object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage

Description

A resource representing a country.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/countries

Returns a listing of all resources available to caller.

GET

/<path-to-app>/countries/:id

Returns a single resource.

Resource : fx-customer-api / ledger-entries

Structure

Content of a 'ledger-entries' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string ledger-entries
Attributes Type Required Comment
trade-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
credit currency-amount

Amount credited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Always a positive number, zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit currency-amount

Amount debited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Always a positive number, zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

balance currency-amount

Net amount credited or debited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

comment string
Relationships Resource Required Comment
domain domains
domain-group domains
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
ledger-account ledger-accounts
currency currencies

Description

Resource representing an entry in the general ledger.

GET

/<path-to-app>/general-ledger/ledger-entries

Resource : fx-customer-api / customer-accounts

Structure

Content of a 'customer-accounts' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-accounts
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

Account Title eg WILLIAM NEWTON

description string
type enum

Valid enum values
PERSONAL Account for personal use of a named individual only
CORPORATE Account for use of a limited liability legal entitiy
CHARITY Account for use of a registered charity
review-status enum

Compliance state

Valid enum values
DATA_REQUIRED Further data needed to review this resource
UNDER_REVIEW Resource in compliance review process
ACCEPTED Resource reviewed and approved
REJECTED Resource reviewed and declined
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
LAPSED Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
INACTIVE Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
CLOSED Resource that is no longer under review
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
object-status enum

Valid enum values

INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered

Valid enum values

Resource : fx-customer-api / customer-quote-requests

Structure

Content of a 'customer-quote-requests' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-quote-requests
Attributes Type Required Comment
ttl number

The time in seconds during which this quote can be accepted. MUST be included if the status attribute is 'OPEN' and has no meaning otherwise.

status enum

The overall status of this quote request. Note that each of the related customer-quotes each have a status attribute that indicates whether that individual quote is tradeable. Client applications should take both into account.

Status of a quote request

Valid enum values
REQUESTED
OPEN
TIMED_OUT
REJECTED
ACCEPTED
TRADED
CANCELLED
margin-amount number

The amount of margin the customer is required to post to support all the amounts quoted in this request. This will typically only apply to forward trades. If this field is present it will be a positive currency amount and the margin-currency relationship MUST be present.

update-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
Relationships Resource Required Comment
update-user people
customer-quotes customer-quotes (many) One or more quotes related to this request.
margin-currency currencies The currency the customer is required to post the margin-amount to support all the amounts quoted in this request. This will typically only apply to forward trades. If this field is present the margin-amount attribute MUST be present.
transactions fx-transactions Transactions that have been booked to the customer-account as a result of accepting the quotes related to this quote request. This relationship will only be present when the status attribute is set to TRADED.
payment-instructions payment-instructions Payment instructions that have been booked to the customer-account as a result of accepting the quotes related to this quote request. This relationship will only be present when the status attribute is set to TRADED.

Description

Represent a quote request. Contains one or more customer-quotes.

Rest Endpoints

POST

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests

Create a new quote request

PATCH

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests/:id

Update an existing quote request

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests/:id

Resource : fx-customer-api / customer-quotes

Structure

Content of a 'customer-quotes' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-quotes
Attributes Type Required Comment
remittance-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remittance-fee currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remittance-information string

Message intended for the beneficiary. Limited to 35 characters.

delivery-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

delivery-fee currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

deliverable boolean
settlement enum

Settlement period for the request

Valid enum values
TODAY Same day settlement
TOMORROW Next good business day settlement
SPOT Second good business day settlement
settlement-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
status enum

The tradeable status of this quote. This quote may only be accepted by the customer when the value of this attribute is TRADEABLE.

Status of a quote request

Valid enum values
TRADEABLE Live price. The server will accept executions on this quote.
INDICATIVE Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as no live price is currently available.
CLOSED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as it is outside of market hours.
SUSPENDED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as market is currently suspended.
NOT_QUOTED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as it doesn't provide prices in thsi curency pair.
comment string

May contain additional info as to why this quote's status is not TRADEABLE.

payment-reason-comment string

If a payment-reason is present additional information MAY be provided to facilitate compliance checking.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
remittance-currency currencies Currency the customer will remit to the domain.
delivery-currency currencies Currency the domain will deliver on behalf of the customer.
beneficiary bank-accounts The bank account to which the domain will deliver currency on behalf of the customer.
payment-reason payment-reasons If beneficiary is present a reason for the resulting payment MAY be provided to facilitate compliance checking.

Description

Represent a set of terms and conditions for a single currency quote.

  • A valid customer-quote-request MUST contain one or more customer-quote resources.
  • The initial customer-quote-request resource that POSTed to the service by a client application MUST contains either a positive remittance-amount attribute or a positive delivery-amount attribute but NOT both. The service will ignore any null or zero values for these attributes
  • Each customer-quote resource MUST reference a remittance-currency and MUST reference either a delivery-currency or a beneficiary but NOT both.
  • If the customer accepts a customer-quote-request the server will execute the least number of fx-transactions required to fulfil that requests related customer-quotes.
  • If the customer accepts a customer-quote-request that contains customer-quotes referencing a beneficiary then server will enter a payment-instruction for the delivery-amount to each such beneficiary.

Rest Endpoints

Resource : fx-customer-api / fx-tickets

Structure

Content of a 'fx-tickets' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string fx-tickets
Attributes Type Required Comment
deliverable boolean

Resource : fx-customer-api / fx-transaction-blocks

Structure

Content of a 'fx-transaction-blocks' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string fx-transaction-blocks
Attributes Type Required Comment
base-amount currency-amount

The amount of the base currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

base-fee currency-amount

The amount of the base currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-amount currency-amount

The amount of the counter currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-fee currency-amount

The amount of the counter currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

margin-amount number
settlement-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
closing boolean

Whether block is the closing side of a customer roll or drawdown. False if not present.

settled boolean

Whether block has been settled. True if not present.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
ticket fx-tickets The parent of this block
transaction fx-transactions The transaction this block formed part of

Description

Represents a single exchange of currency

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/fx-transaction-blocks?query=customer-unsettled&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd

customer :id A valid customer id
date yyyy-mm-dd As of date

Resource : fx-customer-api / fx-positions

Structure

Content of a 'fx-positions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string fx-positions
Attributes Type Required Comment
base-amount currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the base currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

base-fee currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the base currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-amount currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the counter currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-fee currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the counter currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

settlement-date date

Settlement date common to all blocks contributing to this position. Indeterminate if not present.

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

Value date common to all blocks contributing to this position. Indeterminate if not present.

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
settled boolean

Whether contributing blocks have been settled. Indeterminate if not present.

count number

Number of transactions contributing to this position.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
ticket fx-tickets The parent of all blocks contributing to this position.
customer-account customer-accounts The customer account common to all blocks contributing to this position.
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts The customer subaccount common to all blocks contributing to this position.
base-currency currencies First currency of pair common to all blocks contributing to this position.
counter-currency currencies Second currency of pair common to all blocks contributing to this position.

Description

Aggregate of a collection of fx-transaction-blocks 'grouped' by one or more relationship. The grouping is dependent on the query.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-trade&customer=:id

Aggregates fx-transaction-blocks by customer-account and fx-ticket.

Query parameter Value
query customer-unsettled-by-trade
customer :id A valid customer id

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-currency&customer=:id

Aggregates fx-transaction-blocks by customer-account and currency.

Query parameter Value
query customer-unsettled-by-currency
customer :id A valid customer id

Resource : fx-customer-api / payment-instructions

Structure

Content of a 'payment-instructions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string payment-instructions
Attributes Type Required Comment
update-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
amount number
booking-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
status enum

Instruction status

Valid enum values
UNCONFIRMED Payment requires client confirmation
CONFIRMED Payment confirmed by client waiting for acceptance
ACCEPTED Instruction accpted, payment queued for processing
CANCELLED Payment was cancelled
comment string
remittance-information string

Message intended for the beneficiary. Limited to 35 characters.

charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
Relationships Resource Required Comment
beneficiary-bank-account bank-accounts
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
update-user people
currency currencies

Description

Represents a client instruction to make a currency delivery to a given bank account of a beneficiary.

Rest Endpoints

Resource : fx-customer-api / payment-reasons

Structure

Content of a 'payment-reasons' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string payment-reasons
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

The display name of the reason. Suitable for presentation in a UI selection control.

description string

A brief description of the payment reason. Suitable for presentation in a UI as explanation.

comment-required boolean

True if the UI should offer user a comment field for input of additional information. Default value : false

Description

Defines a reason for a payment. Intended to allow the API user to declare the reason for a transfer of funds in order to facilitate compliance checks. Used for UI presentation when creating customer-quotes and payment-instructions.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/payment-reasons

Returns a listing of all resources available to caller.

Resource : fx-customer-api / user-profiles

Structure

Content of a 'user-profiles' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string user-profiles
Relationships Resource Required Comment
user people The user whose profile this is.
caller people The authenticated caller to the service - will differ from the user only if this resource is requested by an fx-domain-api login 'on behalf' of a customer.
customer-account-profiles customer-account-profiles (many) Profiles for each of the customer accounts the user has access to.

Description

Profile for a single resource owner

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/user-profiles/:id

GET

/<path-to-app>/user-profiles/self

Bootstrap resource that returns the profile of the resource owner. Clients can expect the entire relationship graph of 'static' data required by the user to be sideloaded vie the JSON API included mechanism - therefore this is the only call that should be necessary to set up a customer UI.

API application : fx-domain-api

Resource REST endpoints
bank-accounts
GET bank-accounts/:id
Represents a bank account. Required for delivery of currency.
bank-account-field-sets
GET bank-account-field-sets?currency=:currency_id&country=:country_id
Defines a set of fields that are required to create a new bank account.
bank-transactions
GET journal/bank-transactions/:id
GET journal/bank-transactions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a completed bank transfer.
countries
GET countries
GET countries/:id
A resource representing a country.
currencies
GET currencies
GET currencies/:id
A resource representing a currency.
ledger-accounts
GET ledger-accounts
GET ledger-accounts/:id
Resource representing a single account in the general ledger.
ledger-postings
GET ledger-postings
GET ledger-postings/:id
Resource representing a single account in the general ledger.
ledger-entries
GET general-ledger/ledger-entries
Resource representing an entry in the general ledger.
ledger-balances
GET general-ledger/ledger-balances?query=customer-balance-sheet&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
Resource representing an aggregate of ledger-entries in the general ledger.
customer-accounts
GET customer-accounts
GET customer-accounts/:id
Represents a customer account
customer-subaccounts
GET customer-subaccounts/:id
GET customer-accounts/:id/subaccounts
Represents a customer subaccount
customer-bank-accounts
GET customer-bank-accounts/:id
GET customer-accounts/:id/beneficiaries
POST customer-bank-accounts
PATCH customer-bank-accounts/:id
DELETE customer-bank-accounts/:id
A resouce representing association of a bank account to a customer account . Required for delivery of currency.
customer-account-profiles
GET customer-account-profiles/:id
Profile for a single customer account
customer-quote-requests
POST customer-quote-requests
PATCH customer-quote-requests/:id
GET customer-quote-requests/:id
Represent a quote request. Contains one or more customer-quotes.
customer-quotes Represent a set of terms and conditions for a single currency quote.
domain-groups
GET domain-groups
A resource a domains internal silo or business unit
fx-tickets
GET journal/fx-tickets/:id
Parent of a collection of fx-transactions
fx-transactions
GET journal/fx-transactions/:id
GET journal/fx-transactions?query=customer&customer=:id&start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a single transaction of one or more blocks
fx-transaction-blocks
GET journal/fx-transaction-blocks?query=customer-unsettled&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
GET journal/fx-transaction-blocks?query=customer-outstanding&customer=:id&date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a single exchange of currency
fx-positions
GET journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-trade&customer=:id
GET journal/fx-positions?query=customer-unsettled-by-currency&customer=:id
Aggregate of a collection of fx-transaction-blocks 'grouped' by one or more relationship. The grouping is dependent on the query.
payments
GET journal/payments?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a processing payment instruction - allows tracking of currency delivery from payment instruction through to a reconciled bank transaction.
payment-instructions
GET journal/payment-instructions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
GET journal/payment-instructions?query=customer&customer=:id&start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd
Represents a client instruction to make a currency delivery to a given bank account of a beneficiary.
payment-reasons
GET payment-reasons
Defines a reason for a payment. Intended to allow the API user to declare the reason for a transfer of funds in order to facilitate compliance checks. Used for UI presentation when creating customer-quotes and payment-instructions.
people
GET people/:id
GET people/self
Represents an individual
user-profiles
GET user-profiles/:id
GET user-profiles/self
Profile for a single resource owner
domain-profiles
GET domain-profiles/:id
GET domain-profiles/self
Profile for an account manager

Resource : fx-domain-api / bank-accounts

Structure

Content of a 'bank-accounts' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-accounts
Attributes Type Required Comment
beneficiary string

The name of the account to be used for interbank instruction

beneficiary-address string

Address of account holder. Some destination payment systems require this for some account types

iban string

A valid IBAN

bic string

A valid swift institution identifier

account-number string

A valid account number for the destination country's payment system.

national-clearing-code string

A valid clearing code for the destination country's payment system. UK sort code, US ABA routing number etc.

object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage
Relationships Resource Required Comment
domain domains
currency currencies
country countries

Description

Represents a bank account. Required for delivery of currency.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/bank-accounts/:id

Returns a single resource.

Examples

  • 1 : Get resource
  • Hide

Example : Get resource

GET/fx-customer-api/bank-accounts/3 HTTP/1.1Accept: application/vnd.api+jsonAuthorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1N...
Response body...

{
    "data":{
        "id":"3",
        "type":"bank-accounts",
        "attributes":{
            "beneficiary":"Beneficiary 1",
            "iban":"GB31 NWBK 6000 0140 4647 33",
            "bic":"NWBKGB2LXXX"
        },
        "relationships":{
            "country":{
                "data":{
                    "id":"GB",
                    "type":"countries"
                }
            },
            "currency":{
                "data":{
                    "id":"EUR",
                    "type":"currencies"
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

Resource : fx-domain-api / bank-account-field-sets

Structure

Content of a 'bank-account-field-sets' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-account-field-sets
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

The display name of the field set

description string

A brief description of the field set

fields object (many)

An array of field definitions. Each definition ...

  • MUST contain a string 'attribute' property that specifies the attribute name that must be included in the POSTED resource
  • MUST contain a string 'label' attribute containing a suggested display name
  • MUST contain a boolean required field that indicates if the attribute must be provided
  • MAY contain a string 'description' attribute containing suggested explanation of the field
  • MAY contain a string 'regex' attribute containing an input validation rule

Relationships Resource Required Comment
currency currencies
country countries

Description

Defines a set of fields that are required to create a new bank account.

A field set defines a set of attributes that need to be included on POSTed customer-bank-account resource together with suggest display information for presenting a completion form to a user.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/bank-account-field-sets?currency=:currency_id&country=:country_id

Returns a collection of field sests for a currency/country pair.

Query parameter Value
currency :currency_id A valid currency id
country :country_id A valid country id

Resource : fx-domain-api / bank-transactions

Structure

Content of a 'bank-transactions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string bank-transactions
Attributes Type Required Comment
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
credit currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

local-deduction currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remote-deduction currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

type enum
charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
status enum

Transaction status

Valid enum values
PENDING Transaction not reconciled, funds in suspense
RECONCILED Transaction reconciled against customer account
references string (many)
narratives string (many)
advice-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
advice-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
credit-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

requested-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

received-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

local-charges-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remote-charges-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

beneficiary-name string
beneficiary-account string
beneficiary-address string (many)
beneficiary-bank-name string
beneficiary-bank-id string
beneficiary-bank-address string (many)
on-behalf-of-name string
on-behalf-of-address string (many)
payment-type string
payment-detail string (many)
Relationships Resource Required Comment
bank-account bank-accounts
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
ledger-account ledger-accounts
update-user people

Description

Represents a completed bank transfer.

start-date yyyy-mm-dd
end-date yyyy-mm-dd

Resource : fx-domain-api / ledger-entries

Structure

Content of a 'ledger-entries' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string ledger-entries
Attributes Type Required Comment
trade-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
credit currency-amount

Amount credited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Always a positive number, zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

debit currency-amount

Amount debited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Always a positive number, zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

balance currency-amount

Net amount credited or debited to the general ledger for this ledger-account.

Zero if absent.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

comment string
Relationships Resource Required Comment

domain-group domains

Resource : fx-domain-api / customer-accounts

Structure

Content of a 'customer-accounts' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-accounts
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

Account Title eg WILLIAM NEWTON

description string
type enum

Valid enum values
PERSONAL Account for personal use of a named individual only
CORPORATE Account for use of a limited liability legal entitiy
CHARITY Account for use of a registered charity
review-status enum

Compliance state

Valid enum values
DATA_REQUIRED Further data needed to review this resource
UNDER_REVIEW Resource in compliance review process
ACCEPTED Resource reviewed and approved
REJECTED Resource reviewed and declined
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
LAPSED Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
INACTIVE Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
CLOSED Resource that is no longer under review
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
last-reviewed timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage
purpose enum

Purpose of the account

Valid enum values
TRADING
AFFILIATE For the distribution of IB only
Relationships Resource Required Comment
domain domains
domain-group domain-groups
account-manager people

Description

Represents a customer account

Resource : fx-domain-api / customer-bank-accounts

Structure

Content of a 'customer-bank-accounts' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-bank-accounts
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

A short nickname for this bank account

comment string
review-status enum

Compliance state

Valid enum values
DATA_REQUIRED Further data needed to review this resource
UNDER_REVIEW Resource in compliance review process
ACCEPTED Resource reviewed and approved
REJECTED Resource reviewed and declined
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
LAPSED Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
INACTIVE Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
CLOSED Resource that is no longer under review
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
last-reviewed timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
default-charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
default-remittance-information string
object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage
beneficiary string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. The name of the account to be used for interbank instruction

beneficiary-address string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. Address of account holder. Some destination payment systems require this for some account types

iban string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. A valid IBAN

bic string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. A valid swift institution identifier

account-number string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. A valid account number for the destination country's payment system.

national-clearing-code string

Used in POST requests for resource creation only. A valid clearing code for the destination country's payment system. UK sort code, US ABA routing number, etc.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
customer-account customer-account
currency currencies
country countries

Description

A resouce representing association of a bank account to a customer account . Required for delivery of currency.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/customer-bank-accounts/:id

Returns a single resource.

GET

/<path-to-app>/customer-accounts/:id/beneficiaries

/<path-to-app>/customer-bank-accounts

Create a new beneficiary

/<path-to-app>/customer-bank-accounts/:id

Update a beneficiary.

/<path-to-app>/customer-bank-accounts/:id

Delete beneficiary

deliverable-countries countries (many) Countries to which currency may be delivered on behalf of the customer.
payment-reasons payment-reasons (many) The set of possible resonas that this account may give when requesting a payment to a beneficiary.

Resource : fx-domain-api / customer-quote-requests

Structure

Content of a 'customer-quote-requests' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-quote-requests
Attributes Type Required Comment
ttl number

The time in seconds during which this quote can be accepted. MUST be included if the status attribute is 'OPEN' and has no meaning otherwise.

status enum

The overall status of this quote request. Note that each of the related customer-quotes each have a status attribute that indicates whether that individual quote is tradeable. Client applications should take both into account.

Status of a quote request

Valid enum values
REQUESTED
OPEN
TIMED_OUT
REJECTED
ACCEPTED
TRADED
CANCELLED
margin-amount number

The amount of margin the customer is required to post to support all the amounts quoted in this request. This will typically only apply to forward trades. If this field is present it will be a positive currency amount and the margin-currency relationship MUST be present.

update-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
Relationships Resource Required Comment
update-user people
customer-quotes customer-quotes (many) One or more quotes related to this request.
margin-currency currencies The currency the customer is required to post the margin-amount to support all the amounts quoted in this request. This will typically only apply to forward trades. If this field is present the margin-amount attribute MUST be present.
transactions fx-transactions Transactions that have been booked to the customer-account as a result of accepting the quotes related to this quote request. This relationship will only be present when the status attribute is set to TRADED.
payment-instructions payment-instructions Payment instructions that have been booked to the customer-account as a result of accepting the quotes related to this quote request. This relationship will only be present when the status attribute is set to TRADED.

Description

Represent a quote request. Contains one or more customer-quotes.

Rest Endpoints

POST

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests

Create a new quote request

PATCH

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests/:id

Update an existing quote request

GET

/<path-to-app>/customer-quote-requests/:id

Get resource

Examples

  • 1 : Post initial RFQ
  • 2 : Accept RFQ
  • Hide

                }
            }
        },
        "customer-quotes":[
            {
                "data":{
                    "type":"customer-quotes",
                    "attributes":{
                        "remittance-information":"Invoice #1234",
                        "delivery-amount":500,
                        "settlement":"TODAY"
                    },
                    "relationships":{
                        "remittance-currency":{
                            "data":{
                                "type":"currencies",
                                "id":"GBP"
                            }
                        },
                        "beneficiary":{
                            "data":{
                                "type":"bank-accounts",
                                "id":"20643"
                            }
                        },
                        "payment-reason":{
                            "data":{
                                "type":"payment-reasons",
                                "id":"1"
                            }
                        }
                    }
                }
            }

    }

    },
    "included":[
        {
            "id":"e2fce90f-5637-4a26-8afa-8c9952a6414d",

                "remittance-amount":422.3,

                "delivery-amount":500,
                "value-date":"2016-07-05",
                "settlement-time":"2016-07-05T12:00:00",
                "status":"TRADEABLE"
            },
            "relationships":{
                "remittance-currency":{
                    "data":{
                        "id":"GBP",
                        "type":"currencies"
                    }
                },
                "delivery-currency":{
                    "data":{
                        "id":"EUR",
                        "type":"currencies"
                    }
                },
                "beneficiary":{
                    "data":{
                        "id":"20643",
                        "type":"bank-accounts"
                    }
                }
            }
        }
    ]
}

Resource : fx-domain-api / customer-quotes

Structure

Content of a 'customer-quotes' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string customer-quotes
Attributes Type Required Comment
remittance-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remittance-fee currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

remittance-information string

Message intended for the beneficiary. Limited to 35 characters.

delivery-amount currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

delivery-fee currency-amount

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

deliverable boolean
settlement enum

Settlement period for the request

Valid enum values
TODAY Same day settlement
TOMORROW Next good business day settlement
SPOT Second good business day settlement
settlement-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
status enum

The tradeable status of this quote. This quote may only be accepted by the customer when the value of this attribute is TRADEABLE.

Status of a quote request

Valid enum values
TRADEABLE Live price. The server will accept executions on this quote.
INDICATIVE Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as no live price is currently available.
CLOSED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as it is outside of market hours.
SUSPENDED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as market is currently suspended.
NOT_QUOTED Indicative price. The server will reject executions on this quote as it doesn't provide prices in thsi curency pair.
comment string

May contain additional info as to why this quote's status is not TRADEABLE.

payment-reason-comment string

If a payment-reason is present additional information MAY be provided to facilitate compliance checking.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
remittance-currency currencies Currency the customer will remit to the domain.
delivery-currency currencies Currency the domain will deliver on behalf of the customer.
beneficiary bank-accounts The bank account to which the domain will deliver currency on behalf of the customer.
payment-reason payment-reasons If beneficiary is present a reason for the resulting payment MAY be provided to facilitate compliance checking.

Description

Represent a set of terms and conditions for a single currency quote.

  • A valid customer-quote-request MUST contain one or more customer-quote resources.
  • The initial customer-quote-request resource that POSTed to the service by a client application MUST contains either a positive remittance-amount attribute or a positive delivery-amount attribute but NOT both. The service will ignore any null or zero values for these attributes
  • Each customer-quote resource MUST reference a remittance-currency and MUST reference either a delivery-currency or a beneficiary but NOT both.
  • If the customer accepts a customer-quote-request the server will execute the least number of fx-transactions required to fulfil that requests related customer-quotes.
  • If the customer accepts a customer-quote-request that contains customer-quotes referencing a beneficiary then server will enter a payment-instruction for the delivery-amount to each such beneficiary.

Rest Endpoints

Resource : fx-domain-api / fx-transaction-blocks

Structure

Content of a 'fx-transaction-blocks' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string fx-transaction-blocks
Attributes Type Required Comment
base-amount currency-amount

The amount of the base currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

base-fee currency-amount

The amount of the base currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-amount currency-amount

The amount of the counter currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-fee currency-amount

The amount of the counter currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

margin-amount number
settlement-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
closing boolean

Whether block is the closing side of a customer roll or drawdown. False if not present.

settled boolean

Whether block has been settled. True if not present.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
ticket fx-tickets The parent of this block
transaction fx-transactions The transaction this block formed part of

Description

Represents a single exchange of currency

Resource : fx-domain-api / fx-positions

Structure

Content of a 'fx-positions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string fx-positions
Attributes Type Required Comment
base-amount currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the base currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

base-fee currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the base currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-amount currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the counter currency paid or received.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

counter-fee currency-amount

The aggregate amount of the counter currency charged as fee to the customer account.

Amount is signed from the point of view of the domain, so a positive number represents the customer paying, domain receiving and vice versa.

An exact currency amount to the related currency's standard decimal places (usually, but not always, two).

settlement-date date

Settlement date common to all blocks contributing to this position. Indeterminate if not present.

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

Value date common to all blocks contributing to this position. Indeterminate if not present.

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
settled boolean

Whether contributing blocks have been settled. Indeterminate if not present.

count number

Number of transactions contributing to this position.

Relationships Resource Required Comment
ticket fx-tickets The parent of all blocks contributing to this position.
customer-account customer-accounts The customer account common to all blocks contributing to this position.
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts The customer subaccount common to all blocks contributing to this position.
base-currency currencies First currency of pair common to all blocks contributing to this position.
counter-currency currencies Second currency of pair common to all blocks contributing to this position.

Description

Aggregate of a collection of fx-transaction-blocks 'grouped' by one or more relationship. The grouping is dependent on the query.

customer :id A valid customer id

Resource : fx-domain-api / payments

Structure

Content of a 'payments' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string payments
Attributes Type Required Comment
booking-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
value-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
side enum

Payment side

Valid enum values
DEPOSIT Payment added to a customer account
WITHDRAWAL Payment deducted from a customer account
type enum

Payment type

Valid enum values
PRINCIPAL Default value
AGENT Payment made on dehalf of a third party
status enum

Payment status

Valid enum values
SCHEDULED Payment queued for processing
CANCELLED Payment was cancelled
COMPLETED Payment completed
COMPLIANCE_PENDING Payment requires further compliance review
COMPLIANCE_FAILED Payment failed compliance review
FUNDS_PENDING Payment blocked due to lack of customer funds
PROCESSING_PENDING Payment queued for processing
PROCESSING Payment submitted to bank
PROCESSING_FAILED Payment failed processing
RECONCILED Payment completed and reconciled against a bank transaction
comment string
remittance-information string

Message intended for the beneficiary. Limited to 35 characters.

charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
amount number
update-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
Relationships Resource Required Comment
source-bank-account bank-accounts
charge-bank-account bank-accounts
beneficiary-bank-account bank-accounts
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
currency currencies
update-user people

Description

Represents a processing payment instruction - allows tracking of currency delivery from payment instruction through to a reconciled bank transaction.

Rest Endpoints

GET

Resource : fx-domain-api / payment-instructions

Structure

Content of a 'payment-instructions' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string payment-instructions
Attributes Type Required Comment
update-time timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
amount number
booking-date date

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DD
status enum

Instruction status

Valid enum values
UNCONFIRMED Payment requires client confirmation
CONFIRMED Payment confirmed by client waiting for acceptance
ACCEPTED Instruction accpted, payment queued for processing
CANCELLED Payment was cancelled
comment string
remittance-information string

Message intended for the beneficiary. Limited to 35 characters.

charge-code enum

Indicates what charges are accepted. See Swift MT103 71A for further details.

Valid enum values
SHA Shared - each side pays own fees
OUR OUR - payee pays all fees
BEN BEN - benficiary pays all fees
Relationships Resource Required Comment
beneficiary-bank-account bank-accounts
customer-account customer-accounts
customer-subaccount customer-subaccounts
update-user people
currency currencies

Description

Represents a client instruction to make a currency delivery to a given bank account of a beneficiary.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/payment-instructions?start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd

Instruction search

Query parameter Value
start-date yyyy-mm-dd
end-date yyyy-mm-dd

GET

/<path-to-app>/journal/payment-instructions?query=customer&customer=:id&start-date=yyyy-mm-dd&end-date=yyyy-mm-dd

Instruction search for single customer account

Query parameter Value
query customer
customer :id A valid customer id
start-date yyyy-mm-dd
end-date yyyy-mm-dd

Resource : fx-domain-api / payment-reasons

Structure

Content of a 'payment-reasons' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string payment-reasons
Attributes Type Required Comment
name string

The display name of the reason. Suitable for presentation in a UI selection control.

description string

A brief description of the payment reason. Suitable for presentation in a UI as explanation.

comment-required boolean

True if the UI should offer user a comment field for input of additional information. Default value : false

Description

Defines a reason for a payment. Intended to allow the API user to declare the reason for a transfer of funds in order to facilitate compliance checks. Used for UI presentation when creating customer-quotes and payment-instructions.

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/payment-reasons

Returns a listing of all resources available to caller.

Resource : fx-domain-api / people

Structure

Content of a 'people' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string people
Attributes Type Required Comment
id string
name string
first-name string
title string
name string

Family name

gender enum

Valid enum values
MALE
FEMALE
review-status enum

Compliance state

Valid enum values
DATA_REQUIRED Further data needed to review this resource
UNDER_REVIEW Resource in compliance review process
ACCEPTED Resource reviewed and approved
REJECTED Resource reviewed and declined
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
LAPSED Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
INACTIVE Previously ACCEPTED resource that requires re-review due to elapsed time since last review
CLOSED Resource that is no longer under review
NOT_REQUIRED No review process required for this resource
last-reviewed timestamp

ISO Format : YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS
object-status enum

Included in fx-admin-api payloads only

Valid enum values
ACTIVE Default value
INACTIVE Logical delete - can be recovered
DELETED Will be removed from the system at some stage
Relationships Resource Required Comment
domain domains

Description

Represents an individual

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/people/:id

Returns a single resource.

GET

/<path-to-app>/people/self

Bootstrap endpoint that returns the resource corresponding to the resource owner. Think 'whoami' ?

Resource : fx-domain-api / user-profiles

Structure

Content of a 'user-profiles' resource

Resource Type Required Comment
id string System id - should not be interpreted
type string user-profiles
Relationships Resource Required Comment
user people The user whose profile this is.
caller people The authenticated caller to the service - will differ from the user only if this resource is requested by an fx-domain-api login 'on behalf' of a customer.
customer-account-profiles customer-account-profiles (many) Profiles for each of the customer accounts the user has access to.

Description

Profile for a single resource owner

Rest Endpoints

GET

/<path-to-app>/user-profiles/:id

GET

/<path-to-app>/user-profiles/self

Bootstrap resource that returns the profile of the resource owner. Clients can expect the entire relationship graph of 'static' data required by the user to be sideloaded vie the JSON API included mechanism - therefore this is the only call that should be necessary to set up a customer UI.

Supported applicationsBack to top

Tradeconfo.com is a multitenancy service. It supports multiple 'domains' each representing an customer firm (typically an FX brokerage). Each domain contains data segregated into 'domain-groups' or silos. These are typically used to represent business units within a firm. This documentation set covers resources that are made available via three APIs...

fx-customer-api
Application that supports access to one or more customer-accounts by a single user . This application is intended to face a customer of an FX brokerage.
fx-domain-api
Application that supports access to one or more domain-groups within single domain . This application is intended to face an employee or agent of an FX brokerage.
fx-admin-api
Application that supports user access to multiple domains .

Several of the resources documented below include relationships that are only relevant to certain applications. In particular resources such as customer accounts optionally contain a domain and a domain-group relationship. Clients of the fx-customer-api should not rely on these relationships being included in responses (and have no need of them). Likewise clients of the fx-domain-api can expect responses to include domain-group relationships but not domain relationships.

Obtaining an access tokenBack to top

The APIs are secured by OAuth2. In order to access an API resource the resource owner (a user with credentials) must obtain an access token and present it as a header with each call to to the API. OAuth2 specifies several ways to obtain an access token but the simplest way is via the Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant flow . This is documented here : tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.3 .

In this case the client calls the OAuth2 server token end point with a username and password and, if the credentials are valid, receives a short lived access token, a long lived refresh token, and an indication of the time to live of both tokens.

Here is a request...

		POST /auth/realms/a-realm-name/protocol/openid-connect/token HTTP/1.1
		Host:
		auth.tradeconfo.com
		Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
		Origin:https://api.host.tradeconfo.com

		grant_type=password&client_id=ember-test&username=a.user@tradeconfo.com&password=secret

And a successful response...

		{
		"access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJ[...]",
		"expires_in": 60,
		"refresh_expires"_in:
		1800,
		"refresh_token": "eyJhbGci9[...]",
		"token_type": "bearer"
		}

The access token can then be used in a call to an API resource...

		GET /user-profile/self HTTP/1.1
		Host: api.host.tradeconfo.com
		Authorization:Bearer eyJhbGciOiJ[...]
		Accept:application/vnd.api+json

The refresh token can be used to obtain a new access token after expiry...

		POST /auth/realms/a-realm-name/protocol/openid-connect/token HTTP/1.1
		Host:
		auth.tradeconfo.com
		Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
		Origin:https://api.host.tradeconfo.com

		grant_type=refresh_token&client_id=ember-test&refresh_token="eyJhbGci9[...]"
	
		{
		"access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJ[...]",
		"expires_in": 60,
		"token_type":"bearer",
		"refresh_expires_in": 1800,
		"refresh_token":
		"eyJhbGci9[...]"
		}

Bootstrapping an fx-customer-api userBack to top

Once an access token for a resource owner (user) has been obtained from the OAuth2 server the client can make calls into the API. However the client will not know the person resource representing the resource owner on the system or the customer accounts that the resource owner has access to.

The client can bootstrap into this information by a call to the 'GET /user-profile/self' end point. The returned resource will contain the details of the user and an array of customer-account-profiles for each customer-account that the resource owner has access to.

NOTE : The call to 'GET /user-profiles/self' is intended to be the only call required by client to obtain all the 'static' data for setting up a client interface.

The complete relationship graph should be sideloaded in the response to 'GET /user-profiles/self' via the JSON API included mechanism. For example recursive calls to 'GET /people/self' (that would return the resource corresponding to the resource owner), or 'GET /customer-account-profiles' (that would return all the customer accounts for the resource owner), though valid, should never be required.

Bootstrapping an fx-domain-api userBack to top

Once an access token for a resource owner (user) has been obtained from the OAuth2 server the client can make calls into the API. However the client will not know the caller resource representing the resource owner on the system or the customer accounts that the resource owner has access to.

The client can bootstrap into this information by a call to the 'GET /domain-profiles/self' end point. The returned resource will contain the details of the user and will sideload the array of customer-accounts that the resource owner has access to.

NOTE : The call to 'GET /domain-profiles/self' is intended to be the only call required by client to obtain all the 'static' data for setting up a client interface.

The complete relationship graph should be sideloaded in the response to 'GET /domain-profiles/self' via the JSON API included mechanism. For example recursive calls to 'GET /people/self' (that would return the resource corresponding to the resource owner), or 'GET /customer-accounts' (that would return all the customer accounts available to the resource owner), though valid, should never be required.

Version managementBack to top

This API is versioned using the MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH semver convention (http://semver.org) .

The MAJOR version will be incremented for changes that break backward compatability. As the API can be considered stable this is expected to happen very infrequently.

The MINOR version will be incremented for any changes to the API that maintain forward comapatability. Additional resources or the addition of non-required resource attributes and relationships to an existing resource will result in a MINOR version bump only.

The PATCH version will be incremented for updates and improvements to documentation that do not affect the API structure in any way.

Future MAJOR version increments will be supported using the standard HTTP header mechanism. If no header is present client applications should assume the version is 1.x
